intro: Gnaphalium cuneatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. It is often found in grasslands, meadows, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Gnaphalium cuneatum is also known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
